channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AK

item.title: Report X-2024071824
item.description:
Report X-2024071824

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE, ALASKA, ONE GROUND TO ALASKA PACKAGE REQUIRED A REWRAP DUE TO BEING WET FROM RAINWATER. GROUND TO ALASKA IS A LOWER RATE OFFERED BUT THE PACKAGE MUST TRANSPORT IN THE AIR NETWORK. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE INNER BOX MARKED CARTRIDGES, SMALL ARMS, UN0012, 1.4S WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARK. THIS BOX CONTAINS (25) INNER BOXES CONTAINING (20) FRONTIER 62 GR FULL METAL JACKET CARTRIDGES. THIS PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS (7) 50 ROUND BOXES OF WINCHESTER 9MM 124 GRAIN FULL METAL JACKET CARTRIDGES AND (3) 550 ROUND BOXES OF RIMFIRE TARGET CARTRIDGES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024071536
item.description:
Report X-2024071536

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-22
  • City: ANC
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Alaska Airlines
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X RAY OF SHIPMENT SHOWED OUTLINE THAT LOOKED UNCLEAR. BROUGHT TO SMALLER X RAY TO GET A BETTER PICTURE. SAW AN OUTLINE THAT APPEARED TO BE A TOOL AND POSSIBLY BATTERIES. PERFORMED PHYSICAL SEARCH AND CONFIRMED THERE WERE TWO LOOSE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES IN ONE PIECE OF THE SHIPMENT. 36 Wh and 92.5 Wh

item.title: Report X-2024071031
item.description:
Report X-2024071031

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/1/2024 at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp faiility in Anchorage, reporting a dangeorus goods spill. The shipment consisted one fiberboard box containig 4 plastic drums, individually packaged inside of smaller fiberboard box. One of the plastic drums leaked from the closure, resulting in spillage. This shipment was prepared under IATA Special Provision A197 and did not shipped as fully regulated DG. The shipper will be contacted for further disposition.
